Issues.Title: Porting several outstanding `UITypeEditor`s
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Contributes to #1115


## Proposed changes

- Porting several outstanding `UITypeEditor`s
	* `ImageIndexEditor` (Closes #2115)
	* `IconEditor` (Closes #2020)
	* `TabPageCollectionEditor` (Closes #1281)
	* `ContentAlignmentEditor` (Closes #2018)
	* `ListControlStringCollectionEditor` (Closes #1271)
	* `BinaryEditor` (Closes #2017)
	* `DateTimeEditor`  (Closes #2019)
	* `ListViewSubItemCollectionEditor` (Closes #1277)
	* `ListViewGroupCollectionEditor` (Closes #1275)
	* `ListViewItemCollectionEditor` (Closes #1276)
	* `SelectedPathEditor` (Closes #2282)
	* `LinkAreaEditor` (Closes #2284)
	* `FormatStringEditor` (Closes #2281)
	* `HelpNamespaceEditor` (Closes #2283)
	* `MaskedTextBoxTextEditor` (Closes #2286)
	* `MaskPropertyEditor` (Closes #2285)
- Add test scaffolds for UITypeEditors
	* Add editors we missed to the table of intrinsic editors
	* Add positive ack test for editors associated in the table
	* Add entries in test for editors only attached with editor attribute
	* Add editor type to editor test and create basic test for properties
	* Add stubs for all known editors requiring porting
- Partially revert "Porting DataMemberFieldConverter"  f477b2a
Whilst we do not support nor cant be expected to support customers who reference our internals, in some scenarios like `UITypeEditor`s and `TypeConverter`s may still be used by consumers to enhance their runtime experience.
E.g. https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2078#discussion_r337777751
Type forward `DataMemberFieldConverter` to avoid breaking existing customers.

Relates to #1545

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Customers should have access to more UITypeEditors at runtime if they use `PropertyGrid` control. 
NB: The VS Desginer has its own set of editors.


## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual
- CTI 



###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2288)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Porting several outstanding `UITypeEditor`s" (#2288)

Issues.Body:

Fixes #2285 
Fixes #2286 


## Proposed changes

- Adding MaskTextBoxTextEditor, MaskPropertyEditor and related entitity definitions to System.Windows.Forms.Design project.
- Adding required resources.
- Updating System.Design fa√ßade to allow using ported editors.

- Users will be able to use MaskTextBoxTextEditor with MaskedTextBox control and MaskPropertyEditor with Mask property of the MaskTextBox.

Issues.Title: PropertyGridView crashes on editing ListBoxProperty with null values
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

**Actual behavior:** 
Exception while trying to select the item in the list with null-value element:

Exception Thrown: System.ArgumentNullException: 'Key cannot be null.'
 
 > mscorlib.dll!System.Collections.Hashtable.ContainsKey(object key)
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.GridViewListBoxItemAccessibleObjectCollection.this[object].get(object key) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.GridViewListBoxAccessibleObject.SetListBoxItemFocus() Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGridInternal.PropertyGridView.GridViewListBox.OnSelectedIndexChanged(System.EventArgs e) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.WmReflectCommand(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.WndProc(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m) Unknown
  System.Windows.Forms.dll!System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.DebuggableCallback(System.IntPtr hWnd, int msg, System.IntPtr wparam, System.IntPtr lparam) Unknown

**Expected behavior:**
No exception and no crash.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create WinForms app with PropertyGrid control and add some class definition with the collection property bound to a list editor. Create an instance of that class and add null value to the collection of items. Set this created instance to SelectedObject property of the PropertyGrid control.
2. Run the app and try to select something in the list item in the PropertyGrid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PropertyGridView crashes on editing ListBoxProperty with null values" (#2316)
